questions.question: What is an 'epilogue' in a book?
options: A section at the end that wraps up the story

questions.question: What does 'prologue' mean?
options: An introductory section at the beginning of a book

questions.question: What is a 'folio' in publishing terms?
options: A large-format book or a sheet of paper folded once

questions.question: What does 'bibliography' refer to?
options: A list of sources and references used in a work

questions.question: What is a 'manuscript'?
options: An author's original text before publication

questions.question: What does 'abridged' mean when describing a book?
options: Shortened or condensed from the original

questions.question: What is an 'anthology'?
options: A collection of writings by various authors

questions.question: What does 'pseudonym' mean in literature?
options: A pen name used by an author instead of their real name

questions.question: What is a 'foreword' in a book?
options: An introductory statement, usually written by someone other than the author
The first word of the story

questions.question: What does 'tome' refer to?
options: A large, heavy, or scholarly book

questions.question: What is a 'galley proof'?
options: A preliminary version of a book used for review before final printing

questions.question: What does 'errata' refer to in a published book?
options: A list of errors and their corrections

questions.question: What is an 'addendum'?
options: The first draft of a chapter
A type of adhesive used in bookbinding
Additional material added at the end of a book

questions.question: What does 'out of print' mean?
options: The book is no longer being published or available from the publisher
The book has too many typos

questions.question: What is a 'blurb' on a book?
options: A short promotional description, usually on the back cover
